items.title: U.S.-China Tariff Cuts: Is the 2025 Stock Market Sell-Off Officially Over?
items.author: The Motley Fool
items.description: The article discusses how the broader market indexes soared on Monday, May 12, in response to news that the U.S. and China would pause their reciprocal tariffs on most goods for 90 days. It also highlights how some companies, such as Microsoft, Meta Platforms, and American Express, were doing well despite the trade war tensions, and how investors should focus on quality companies during volatile periods.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: The article mentions that Microsoft reported phenomenal results and reaffirmed its upbeat revenue and operating margin guidance, indicating the company was doing well despite the trade war tensions.

The article states that Meta Platforms ramped up its data center and artificial intelligence investments, and management forecast higher capital expenditures this year, suggesting the company was in a strong position.
The article mentions Alphabet as one of the examples of companies that were doing well even when trade war tensions were high.
The article mentions Alphabet as one of the examples of companies that were doing well even when trade war tensions were high.

The article notes that American Express reported excellent results and reaffirmed its full-year guidance, and that its long-term investment thesis looks stronger than ever, despite the stock price getting clobbered.
The article states that shares of Apple got crushed due to its exposure to China, both as a manufacturing hub and as a major market for sales.
The article mentions that shares of Nike got crushed due to its exposure to China.
The article notes that Nvidia said it would be taking a $5.5 billion charge in its fiscal 2026 first quarter due to the trade war tensions.

items.title: Amex CTO Hilary Packer on AI Strategy
items.description: American Express Executive Vice President & Chief Technology Officer Hilary Packer discusses her strategy for continuous modernization to prepare for a digital future with Bloomberg's Lisa Mateo...
